item.title: Rubbish being dumped and not cleared, 22nd August
item.description:
Ever since the pedestrianisation of the junction of Wilds Rents and Long Lane, Graduate Place has been a focus of flytipping and dumping of household waste. Our bins are used for all sorts of rush, from domestic, appliance, to dog waste, and rubbish is strewn across the ground in front of our properties. It was a problem before but is much worse now. The incident I am reporting needs resolving but, longterm, how will this be prevented?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wild's Rents, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Request for Litter Cleanup in Densole and King Hall Road Area Reported via desktop in the Litter and Detritus, 22nd August
item.description:
Urgent Request for Litter Cleanup in Densole and King Hall Road Area Reported via desktop in the Litter and Detritus category anonymously at 08:17, Thursday 24 July 2025 Sent to Bromley Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 7924859. I am writing to raise a concern about the ongoing litter problem in the Densole and King Hall Road area. The streets have not been cleaned for over seven weeks, and the accumulation of rubbish has now become a serious health and environmental issue for residents and passers-by. As a local resident, I kindly request that the council take immediate action to organise a thorough sweep and cleanup of the area. The current state of the streets is not only unsightly but also poses risks to public health and safety. I would also appreciate it if the relevant management teams could review the current street cleaning schedule and ensure that regular maintenance is resumed to prevent this issue from recurring. The management needs to take a look at it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I have reported the poor condition of the road in The Grove North Cray on several occasions. I live at No.4 and for a long stretch there are strips in the road that have crumbled away. This has been repaired in the past but the response recently was an inspection did nor warrant a repair at the moment. h, 22nd August
item.description:
I have raised the problem with the road in The Grove I live at No 4 and there are strips in the road, for some distance, that are breaking up. The Council inspected these and considered them as not in need of urgent repair. These same strips have been repaired by the Council in the past. About 3 weeks ago members of the Council visited our road and took pictures of the condition of the road, after calling on me. They said this would be reported. The main issue is the noise of cars and delivery vehicles going over these strips which neighbours can clearly hear inside their houses. You have photos which I provided before (Ref: 7308765) Can you please inspect and listen out for the noise these strips are causing as evidenced by your councillors. Thank You
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Grove, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
